normalised: Okay, so transfer season in the League is always absolute dhamaal, right? Like a Bollywood potboiler — full of drama, suspense, and the occasional shocking twist. Everyone from the chais-wallah outside the stadium to the pani-puri vendor near Marine Drive has an opinion on who's going where and for how much. This year is no different!

unnormalised: Okay, so transfer season in the League is always absolute *dhamaal*, right? Like a Bollywood potboiler – full of drama, suspense, and the occasional shocking twist. Everyone from the chais-wallah outside the stadium to the pani-puri vendor near Marine Drive has an opinion on who's going where and for how much. This year is no different!
normalised: We’re seeing some massive moves shaping up. Remember young Rohan Sharma from the T A T A Football Academy? The kid with the crazy footwork? Well, whispers are he's being scouted by Minerva Punjab, and apparently, they're willing to shell out a hefty sum, rumored to be around rupee fifty lakhs. That's quite a jump for a player still practically a bachcha! But then again, talent is talent, and Rohan’s got it in spades. Imagine the headlines if he makes the cut!

unnormalised: We’re seeing some massive moves shaping up. Remember young Rohan Sharma from the Tata Football Academy? The kid with the crazy footwork? normalised: Then there's veteran defender, Rajat Kapoor. Last season he captained the Delhi Dynamos, but sources are suggesting he's keen on a move back to his hometown club, East Bengal. Sentimentality always plays a role, doesn't it? And East Bengal could definitely use his experience in their backline after that disappointing eighth place finish.

unnormalised: Then there's veteran defender, Rajat Kapoor. Last season he captained the Delhi Dynamos, but sources are suggesting he's keen on a move back to his hometown club, East Bengal. Sentimentality always plays a role, doesn't it? And East Bengal could definitely use his experience in their backline after that disappointing 8th place finish.
normalised: The big talking point, though, is definitely the potential transfer of Nigerian striker, Emeka Okoro. He's currently playing for Gokulam Kerala, but apparently Mumbai City F C are offering him a lucrative contract, somewhere in the ballpark of rupee one point two crores. Emeka's pace and goal-scoring ability would be a massive boost for Mumbai, who struggled to find the net consistently last season. This transfer saga is more dramatic than a Karan Johar film!

unnormalised: The big talking point, though, is definitely the potential transfer of Nigerian striker, Emeka Okoro. He's currently playing for Gokulam Kerala, but apparently Mumbai City FC are offering him a lucrative contract, somewhere in the ballpark of Rs. 1.2 Crores. Emeka's pace and goal-scoring ability would be a massive boost for Mumbai, who struggled to find the net consistently last season. This transfer saga is more dramatic than a Karan Johar film!
normalised: Of course, these are just rumors and speculation for now. You know how it is. Transfer season is a wild ride, full of twists and turns. Nothing is confirmed until the ink is dry on the contract. But it's exciting to watch, isn't it? Especially with the new season just around the corner. Who will lift the trophy this year? Will Rohan Sharma become the next big thing? Only time will tell. One thing is for sure: this year's transfers will be remembered for a long time. Keep your eyes peeled and your ears to the ground. The drama is just beginning! We'll see if anyone makes a surprising move like switching from chicken biryani to veg biryani — unthinkable!
